2023-10-21T22:53:21Z: Given Sunday is seven minutes away (in the UK at least) we'll call time on this live text coverage of the US GP sprint Saturday. We'll be back tomorrow for the build-up to the US GP which starts at 8pm BST. Until then, go well!
2023-10-21T22:51:56Z: So that was the sprint race. Verstappen controlled it from pole, but he has a much tougher challenge tomorrow given he starts from sixth place. Let's see what Sunday brings.
2023-10-21T22:49:28Z:
Here's the race report on the US GP sprint race - Verstappen's six sprint race win out of 11 in total: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/f1-united-states-gp-verstappen-beats-hamilton-for-sprint-race-victory/10535978/
    
Photo by: Glenn Dunbar / Motorsport Images
Max Verstappen, Red Bull Racing RB19
2023-10-21T22:39:56Z: Verstappen slips out of his Red Bull and appears content with his day's work. It wasn't the most memorable of F1 sprint races, but the Dutch driver won't care one bit.
2023-10-21T22:38:42Z: With Albon in the unlucky ninth place, Piastri takes 10th ahead of Ocon, Ricciardo, Alonso, Tsunoda, Hulkenberg, Bottas, Zhou, Magnussen and Sargeant as the final finisher.
2023-10-21T22:37:24Z: Norris just misses out on catching Leclerc so settles for fourth, with Perez fifth and Sainz sixth. Russell's penalty drops him to eighth and behind Gasly - but he keeps 0.3s ahead of Albon for the final points place.
2023-10-21T22:35:48Z: Verstappen wins the United States GP sprint race! Hamilton takes second and Leclerc completes the podium.
2023-10-21T22:35:19Z: Zhou's been given a five-second penalty for leaving the track and gaining an advantage. He's currently 16th and not doing much with it.
2023-10-21T22:34:25Z: Final lap time, as Verstappen leads by eight seconds.
2023-10-21T22:34:02Z: Russell is still stuck behind Sainz and is now at risk of scoring no points today. Albon, in ninth, is on the edge of five seconds behind Russell.
2023-10-21T22:32:59Z: Stroll retires from the sprint race on lap 17 as his brakes have gone on his Aston Martin. He was limited to five laps in practice due to a brake issue, so more brake misery for the Canadian.
2023-10-21T22:31:53Z: It is a good distraction for this sprint race fizzling out. Verstappen is in control with a 6.2s lead over Hamilton and he also has six seconds in hand over Leclerc.
2023-10-21T22:30:47Z: Back in Spain Russell mistook sweat for rain on his visor and now his car thinks it is raining in COTA with the sun shining. How odd.
2023-10-21T22:29:43Z: Russell's rain lights on his car appear to be on for some reason.
2023-10-21T22:28:04Z: Further back it is a great move by Ricciardo to go around the outside on Stroll at Turn 1 to gain 12th place.
2023-10-21T22:27:12Z: Russell vs Sainz into Turn 1 at COTA flashbacks of last year are avoided, as Sainz cuts back under Russell to retain sixth place into Turn 2.
2023-10-21T22:25:41Z: The gaps between the frontrunners have all stretched out, with Russell stuck behind Sainz in the fight for sixth.
2023-10-21T22:24:23Z: After that early concern Verstappen is travelling serenely towards this sprint race win. The gap is 4.2s over Hamilton at the start of lap 13.
2023-10-21T22:22:54Z: On lap 11 Perez only needs DRS to fly by Sainz to take fifth place. The Spaniard has Russell 1.2s behind him but the Mercedes driver has that five-second penalty remember.
2023-10-21T22:21:43Z: Sainz now has Perez for company as his soft tyre gamble isn't paying off.
2023-10-21T22:20:43Z: On lap 10 Norris gets by Sainz, using DRS, on the way into Turn 12. That puts the McLaren driver up to fourth.
2023-10-21T22:19:25Z: 10 laps to go and Verstappen's lead is 2.8s over Hamilton and Leclerc is 3.6s back on Hamilton.
2023-10-21T22:18:33Z: Piastri is having a stinker. He's struggling to keep his McLaren on the track and he's been shown the black and white flag for track limits - one more and he'll get a penalty.
2023-10-21T22:17:37Z: Norris looks for a move on Sainz at Turn 12 but the Ferrari driver fights back to retain fourth place. Their squabble is inviting Perez into the battle.
2023-10-21T22:16:35Z: Verstappen is pulling clear at the front, as on lap eight he is 2.3s clear of Hamilton. The driveability issue that was troubling him earlier appears to have been solved.
2023-10-21T22:15:28Z: Piastri is sinking through the order as he loses ninth place to Albon.
2023-10-21T22:14:56Z: Russell has been given a five-second penalty for leaving the track overtaking Piastri.
2023-10-21T22:14:14Z: Sainz's softs might be crying enough already as on lap six Norris is all over the rear of his car in the fight for fourth.
2023-10-21T22:13:09Z: The stewards are looking into Russell going off the track to overtake Piastri.
2023-10-21T22:11:43Z: Gasly gets by Qatar sprint winner Piastri into Turn 1 at the start of lap five to give the French driver the final points place.
2023-10-21T22:11:00Z: A replay of the start shows Piastri and Sainz made slight contact before the braking zone for Turn 1. Could the McLaren driver be carrying damage?
2023-10-21T22:10:09Z: That fight invites Russell to attack Piastri who overtakes the Aussie to take seventh, but it appears he took the place off the track.
2023-10-21T22:09:56Z: Perez gives it another go on Piastri at Turn 12, but this time the Red Bull driver has enough of his car alongside to fight for the place at Turn 13 and he gets ahead.
2023-10-21T22:08:19Z: Verstappen is over a second clear of Hamilton at the end of lap two, but the pair have bolted clear of Leclerc and Sainz directly behind.
2023-10-21T22:07:30Z: Perez pulls alongside Piastri on the back straight with DRS but is hung out to dry on the outside of Turn 12 so cannot get the move done for sixth.
2023-10-21T22:06:50Z: DRS is enabled as Verstappen looks to shoot clear of Hamilton at the front. Further back Perez is hunting down the two McLarens.
2023-10-21T22:06:12Z: Russell made a great start to gain three spots and negate his grid drop. Magnussen was another smart starter to gain three spots and move up to 14th.
2023-10-21T22:05:40Z: Sainz, on the softs, dives up the inside of Norris at Turn 12 to take fourth place. Verstappen leads from Hamilton and Leclerc.
2023-10-21T22:04:54Z: Lights out! Verstappen goes super aggressive to cut Leclerc off from taking the lead on the inside of Turn 1! He leads as Hamilton moves ahead of Leclerc around the outside, but was he off the track?
2023-10-21T22:02:47Z: Verstappen has picked up the pace, as the F1 train comes through the final couple of corners to get ready for the start. Here we go.
2023-10-21T22:01:09Z: The formation lap is under way as Verstappen crawls up the hill to Turn 1 to keep everyone trundling along very slowly.
2023-10-21T22:00:20Z: Out of the medium runners, Albon and Hulkenberg are on new tyres and the rest are on used.
2023-10-21T22:00:13Z: I wonder how Sainz feels when he is told literally everyone else on the track has gone with Plan A and he's gone Plan B. B for bold.
2023-10-21T21:57:54Z: Tyres: Sainz is the sole gambler on the softs as everyone else is on mediums.
2023-10-21T21:55:14Z: The sprint race winners in 2023 so far are Perez (Azerbaijan), Verstappen (Austria and Belgium) and Piastri (Qatar). Who are you backing for sprint race glory this time?
2023-10-21T21:52:26Z: In F1 history there has been 10 sprint races so far, and just one team is yet to score a single point in this format: AlphaTauri. Ricciardo starts 10th and will surely be out to break that duck.
2023-10-21T21:49:56Z: After the sweat-a-thon that was the Qatar GP, this US GP sprint is going to be a hot one with air temperature up at 33.2C but the humidity is much, much kinder, so there shouldn't be drivers pulling out or taking a trip to the medical centre.
2023-10-21T21:43:50Z: Russell has made his sprint race a little trickier by picking up a three-place grid drop for blocking Leclerc in sprint qualifying, which puts him from eighth to 11th and promotes Albon, Gasly and Ricciardo up a spot each.
2023-10-21T21:39:39Z: All of the drivers have made it to the grid with the sprint race start a little over 20 minutes away. It'll be a 19-lap dash, or 104.424km to be precise, with the top eight finishers picking up the points.
2023-10-21T21:36:46Z: Verstappen was hampered by engine driveability issues in sprint qualifying which impacted his engine mapping settings. That, plus carrying a bit more fuel, is estimated to have cost him two-tenths of a second. Full story: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/why-we-havent-seen-verstappens-real-advantage-at-the-f1-us-gp-yet/10535921/
2023-10-21T21:34:16Z: The drivers are on their way to the grid for lights out at 11pm BST. Verstappen starts on pole having nailed his qualifying laps earlier today, beating Leclerc by 0.055s, but it was far from smooth sailing.
2023-10-21T21:32:10Z: Good evening one and all! Who fancies some late night F1 sprint race action?
2023-10-21T18:32:40Z: We're off for some dinner now, but we'll be back shortly before the sprint at 11pm BST!
2023-10-21T18:32:23Z: Read the full sprint shootout report here: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/f1-united-states-gp-sprint-quali-report/10535848/
2023-10-21T18:16:03Z: Perez, Russell, Albon and Gasly complete the top 10.
2023-10-21T18:15:50Z: Hamilton lines up third next to Norris, with Piastri and Sainz behind them.
2023-10-21T18:15:20Z: Verstappen claims his third sprint pole of the season, with Leclerc alongside him on the front row.
2023-10-21T18:15:02Z: Hamilton is third fastest for Mercedes as Russell goes eighth.
2023-10-21T18:14:39Z: Perez is next over the line, sixth fastest and 0.5s down on his team-mate.
2023-10-21T18:14:13Z: Leclerc goes second, 0.055s off Verstappen's time. So close!
2023-10-21T18:13:58Z: Piastri slots into third, with Gasly in fourth.
2023-10-21T18:13:30Z: Verstappen crosses the line with a 1m34.538s. Norris misses out by 0.1s.
2023-10-21T18:12:38Z: Norris sets a purple first sector as the flying laps get underway.
2023-10-21T18:10:12Z: Verstappen heading out triggered a domino effect, so everyone is heading out on track now.
2023-10-21T18:09:45Z: Five minutes left on the clock, and cars are finally leaving the garages. Thanks guys - you took your time!
2023-10-21T18:04:39Z: Perez was fifth ahead of Piastri, Gasly, Russell, Hamilton and Albon.
2023-10-21T18:04:20Z: Verstappen was quickest, ahead of the two Ferraris and Lando Norris.
2023-10-21T18:02:47Z: That's Ricciardo, Alonso, Ocon, Stroll and Zhou knocked out after SQ2.
2023-10-21T18:00:02Z: Albon knocks Alonso into the bottom five as Zhou fails to improve into the top 10.
2023-10-21T17:59:44Z: Gasly goes seventh, pushing his team-mate into the bottom five.
2023-10-21T17:59:29Z: Currently in the bottom five are Stroll, Zhou, Albon, Gasly and Ricciardo.
2023-10-21T17:58:58Z: Alonso gets out the bottom five, up into eighth, with Stroll ninth.
2023-10-21T17:58:37Z: Verstappen spun at Turn 9 - too much kerb, loses the rear, sweeps across the grass. Not ideal.
2023-10-21T17:57:49Z: Verstappen has been off - muddy tyres giving him away there.
2023-10-21T17:57:39Z: No further investigation into the Hamilton / Tsunoda incident.
2023-10-21T17:55:26Z: Alonso and Ocon tripping over each other there in pitlane as everyone heads out with four minutes left on the clock.
2023-10-21T17:54:27Z: Five minutes to go. Can anyone better Verstappen's time?
2023-10-21T17:53:36Z: Leclerc slots into second, Sainz is third and Perez is fourth.
2023-10-21T17:52:56Z: Verstappen sets a 1m35.181s as an early benchmark.
2023-10-21T17:49:57Z: It's time for SQ2! 10 minutes for 10 cars to make it through to SQ3.
2023-10-21T17:49:31Z: Several drivers will be investigated after the session for failing to follow the race directors' instructions on the maximum delta time. They are Russell, Albon, Hulkenberg, Magnussen, Gasly, Piastri, Bottas, Tsunoda and Perez.
2023-10-21T17:48:29Z: Verstappen was, unsurprisingly, quickest in SQ1. Who will top SQ2?
2023-10-21T17:47:52Z: Another close moment between Hamilton and Tsunoda - the Mercedes driver says the two touched.
2023-10-21T17:46:59Z: That inchident will be investigated after the session.
2023-10-21T17:44:02Z: Ricciardo squeezes through into Shootout 2 and knocks out Hulkenberg, who joins his team-mate, Bottas, Tsunoda and Sargeant in an Shootout 1 exit.
2023-10-21T17:43:35Z: Bottas improves, but only to 17th, with Sargeant also remaining in the bottom five.
2023-10-21T17:43:03Z: Stroll gets himself out the bottom five - he's up to 12th.
2023-10-21T17:39:44Z: Currently in the elimination zone with less than three minutes remaining are Bottas, Magnussen, Ricciardo, Stroll and Sargeant.
2023-10-21T17:38:16Z: Verstappen tops the timesheet with a 1m35.997s - 0.3s clear of Leclerc
2023-10-21T17:36:17Z: Leclerc now goes quickest, with Sainz second, as Verstappen starts his first flying lap
2023-10-21T17:35:54Z: Norris slots into second, with Albon in third
2023-10-21T17:35:13Z: Hamilton clocks a 1m36.4012s to lead, as Hulkenberg, Bottas and Magnussen also set their first times
2023-10-21T17:34:28Z: The flying laps are now getting underway, with Lewis Hamilton currently putting in his first effort
2023-10-21T17:30:48Z: Green light at the end of pitlane and the session is underway...
2023-10-21T17:28:32Z: It's 4 °C cooler today than it was during yesterday's qualifying, with an air temperature of 31.9 °C.
2023-10-21T17:20:27Z: US GP promoter Bobby Epstein says he’s surprised that ticket sales have not been boosted by it becoming a sprint race this year. Read more here: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/sprint-race-switch-has-not-boosted-us-gp-f1-ticket-sales-says-cota/10535789/
2023-10-21T17:14:59Z: Piastri took pole for the last sprint in Qatar, can the McLaren driver repeat the feat at COTA? Or will Spa sprint poleman Verstappen be top again?
2023-10-21T17:10:27Z: Charles Leclerc took pole for Sunday's race after Max Verstappen lost a time 0.005s quicker to a last-gasp Q3 track limits violation. Read the full qualifying report here: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/f1-united-states-gp-qualifying/10535322/
2023-10-21T17:09:36Z: Good evening and welcome to our live updates for F1's United States GP! It's almost time for the sprint shootout.
